Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.view

Class ActionView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.view.TerminalView
it.polimi.ingsw.client.cli.view.ActionView
public class ActionView extends TerminalView
This Class represent the TerminalView that parses an input command from the user

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    didReceiveActionResponse(Notification notification)
    Callback for a Notification with name ActionResponse The method prints the outcome of the performed action, and an error message if it fails
    private void
    didReceiveActivePlayer(Notification notification)
    Callback for a Notification with name ActivePlayer The method prints a "waiting" message if the Player has to wait for their turn before issuing a command
    private void
    didReceiveMatchPhase(Notification notification)
    Callback for a Notification with name MatchPhase The method prints the list of commands that are available for the current match phase
    protected void
    didReceiveNetworkTimeoutNotification(Notification notification)
    Callback for a Notification with name NetworkTimeoutNotification The method prints an error message that describes the timeout error and terminates the execution of the program
    private void
    didReceiveVictory(Notification notification)
    Callback for a Notification with name Victory The method prints the name of winner player and terminates the execution (since the match ended)
    private void
    endMatch()
    Method to terminate the match and close the program
    private void
    parseInputCommands()
    This method parses the action from the command line, checks the parameters and type of action, and if they are correct it sends a Message containing the action data
    private void
    printAvailableCommands()
    Pretty-prints the list of commands available for the current match phase, with a description of the parameters required
    private void
    printCaret()
    Prints the indicator with the player nickname and a ">"
    void
    run()
    Starts the View loop by subscribing the object to all relevant notifications and starts listening for an incoming input command
